snippet: American officials say they are trying to balance the desire to move quickly against the Islamic State while also addressing concerns that Iraqi ground forces may not be prepared.
abstract: Attempts to bring about major offensive against Islamic State forces in Mosul, Iraq's second-largest city, are hampered by lack of readiness by Iraqi Army; push would require coordinated effort between government and local tribal forces, groups that have rarely worked together.

byline.contributor: Omar al-Jawoshy and Falih Hassan contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: American officials say they are trying to balance the desire to move quickly against the Islamic State while also addressing concerns that Iraqi ground forces may not be prepared.

headline.main: Signs of a Push Against ISIS, Amid Doubts on Iraqi Troops
headline.print_headline: Signs of a Push Against ISIS, Amid Doubts on Iraqi Troops
